txt.en: Opens the Social panel to the Instance Grouping tab, filtering optional parameters.\n

usage:  /ignore add <name>     : Adds a player to your ignore list.
        /ignore remove <name>  : Removes a player from your ignore list.
        /ignore list         : Displays the players you currently have ignored.
usage: /lfi \[ min level | max level \] | \[ filter \]
manages and displays your ignore list.\n
usage: /music [ true | false | on | off ]\n
usage: /bug\n
usage: /accountinfo\n
Display your current account status information.\n
usage: /petattack (on current selection)\n
\tCommands all of your currently active pets to attack your\n\tcurrently specified target\n

usage: /raidshout <text to shout>
  1)Must be in a Raid Group
  2)Must be the leader of the Raid
  3)Must supply a text string.
This command will shout out a set of text from the raid leader to the rest of the group.
usage: /broadcast <msg>\n
Sends a message to the broadcast channel in your area.\n
usage: /follow \n
usage /resetui
This command is used to force all standard UI elements to be displayed again if they had been disabled by a plugin.
Opens the Social panel to the Who tab, filtering optional parameters.\n
usage: /who \[ min level | max level \] | \[ filter \]
usage: /userchat <channel-name> <msg>\n
Sends a message to the specified user chat channel.\n
usage: /leavechannel <channel-name>\n
usage: /trade <msg>\n
This will leave the specified user chat-channel.\n
Sends a message to the trade channel in your current area.\n
usage:  /retell message\n
usage: /inscribe <text>\n
sends text of message to the last player you /tell'd\n
inscribe the selected item with the given text.\n
usage: /uninscribe <text>\n
usage: /petlist\n
uninscribe the selected item.\n
\tLists all of your currently outstanding pets.\n
usage: /inspect <target>\n
Inspect the selected player.\n
usage /plugins \[load\] <plugin name> | \[unload\] <script state> | \[list\] | \[refresh\] | \[manager\]
usage: /cpet < rename <name> | tricklist | <trickname> >\n

/plugins load <plugin name>
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Attempts to load the plugin.

/plugins unload
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Unloads all the loaded plugins and resets the ui.

/plugins list
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Lists the set of available plugins and the list of loaded plugins.

/plugins refresh
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Refreshes the list of available plugins from disk.

/plugins manager
ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Opens the plugin manager.
usage: /stuck\n

/cpet rename <name> - renames the cosmetic pet you currently have summoned to the specified name
/cpet tricklist - Lists the available tricks for your cosmetic pet
/cpet <trickname> - Commands the cosmetic pet you currently have summoned to perform the specified trick
usage: /emotelist\n
displays a list of emotes you can perform.\n
usage: /adopt\n
usage /exit\n
This command will send an adoption request to your current target.
This command is used to immediately exit from the game.\n
usage: /chatlog < on | off | capture >\n
Turns on/off logging chat to a file, or captures text already sent to a file\n
usage: /kinship < disband | recruit | accept | decline | quit | expel | promote | demote | motd | successor | resign >\n
Marks yourself as a role player.\n

(disband) - Disband your kinship.
(recruit <name>) - Recruit the target into your kinship.
(accept) - Accept your current kinship recruitment request.
(decline) - Decline your current kinship recruitment request.
(quit) - Voluntarily leave your kinship.
(expel <name>) - Expel the kinship member from your kinship.
(promote <name>) - Promote the kinship member to the next higher rank.
(demote <name>) - Demote the kinship member to the next lower rank.
(motd <motd>) - Set the message of the day for your kinship.
(successor <name>) - Make the kinship member the member who will succeed you as leader when you resign.
(resign) - Step down as leader. (This will automatically promote your successor to leader.)
Performs an emote.\n
Lists your ABC music files with an optional filter. Wildcards '*' and '?' are supported.\n
usage /ui \[layout \[<save|load> \[<filename>\]\]\]\n
usage: /tr <msg>\n

This command can be used to save or load a UI layout.

To save a ui layout use:
  /ui layout save <filename>

To load a ui layout use:
  /ui layout load <filename>

In the file name you can use %r to substitute in the current resolution and %c to substitute in the character's name.

If no filename is specified, a default filename of the form Default_%r is used.
Sends a message to all members of your tribe\n
usage: /localtime\nalternative: /time\n
usage: /yield\n
Returns the local time on your PC.\n
When in a sparring match, this will make you forfeit the match.\n
usage: /queueposition\nalternative: /qp\n
Display your current position in the encounter queue (if any).\n
usage: /ko <msg> - send <msg> to all officers of your kinship\n
usage: /k <msg>\n
usage: /o <msg> - send <msg> to all officers of your kinship\n
usage: /rp <on|off>\n
Sends a message to all members of your kinship\n
Usage: /automove\n
Toggles whether or not you stand your ground in combat.\n
usage: /lff <msg>\n
usage: /changename <new name>\n
Sends a message to the global LFF channel.\n
Allows you to change your character's name. This command can only be used if you have a rename credit available.\n
usage: /afk <message>\n
usage: /play <song file> \[index #\] \[sync\]\n
usage: /arda\n
usage: /pet < attack | follow | stay | assist < on | off > | guard | passive | skill1 | skill2 | skill3 | skill4 | status | release | releaseall | rename <name>>\n
usage: /world <msg>\n

attack - commands all of your active pets to attack your current selection
	follow - commands all of your pets to follow you, breaking attack if necessary
	stay - commands all of your pets to stay where they are
	guard on - puts your pets in guard mode where they will defend themselves or you from attacks
	guard off - turns off guard mode for your pets
	skill1, skill2, skill3 <on|off>- commands your pets to execute the corresponding skills (attack, skill, etc.)
	release - releases the target pet from your service
	releaseall -releases all of your pets from your service
Sends a message to the world chat channel.\n
usage: /emote <text>\n
causes you to emote the specified text\n
After 60 seconds, returns you to the closest rally point.\n
usage: /RPC <msg>\n
usage: /spar with a valid player target selected.\nusage: /duel with a valid player target selected.\n
Sends a message to the RP channel in your current area.\n
These commands will invite a valid player target that is selected to a sparring match.\n
Opens bug entry.\n
Puts you into music mode so you can play an equipped instrument.\n
usage: /anon <on|off>\nalternative: /anonymous <on|off>\n
usage: /played\n
displays how long this character has been in the world\n
usage: /userchat# <msg>\n
Sends a message to specified '#' user chat channel.\n
usage: /tutorial <enable|disable|reset>\n
Enables, Disables or resets tutorial hints.\n
This command will only work in a fellowship or raid.
usage: /help <cmd_name>\n
No available tricks for this pet.
gives help on the named command\n
usage: /finvite < player >\nalternative: /invite < player > \n
usage: /raid < create | disband | invite | dismiss | promote | demote | locks | swap | leave>\n
usage: /to <msg> - send <msg> to all officers of your tribe\n
Invite the given player into your fellowship.\n

(create <name>) - Create a raid with yourself as the leader.
(disband) - Disband your raid.
(invite <name>) - Recruit the target into your raid.
(dismiss <name>) - Expel the member from the raid.)
(promote <name>) - Promote the member to raid assistant.
(demote <name>) - Demote the raid assistant.
(swap <name1> <name2>) - Swaps the two members' positions in the raid.
(leave) - Leave your raid.
usage: /o <msg> - send <msg> to all officers of your tribe\n
usage: /listchannels\n
This will list the user chat-channels you're currently enrolled in.\n
usage: /servertime\n
usage: /roll <range> (default 100) \n/random <range> (default 100)\n
Returns the server's local time.\n
This command will perform a roll from 1 to the <range> and display that to all members in the group.

Plays the song contained in the given file. You must be in /music mode for this to work. If you supply a number for 'index #', the corresponding song in the file (defined with the X: field) will be played. The optional 'sync' parameter makes your character wait for someone in your group to use /playstart.\n
Opens the Social panel to the Quest Grouping tab, filtering optional parameters.\n
usage: /lfq \[ min level | max level \] | \[ filter \]
Available tricks for this pet:
usage:  /useselection\n
usage: /loc\n
tries to use the selection\n

usage:  /friend add <name>    : Adds a player to your friends list.
        /friend remove <name> : Removes a player from your friends list.
        /friend list        : Displays the status of everyone in your friends list.
reports your current location\n
manages and queries your friends list.\n
usage: /damagetext < all < true | false > | other < true | false > | range < new range > | list >\n

/damagetext all < true | false >
            : sets whether or not you see damage text.
/damagetext other < true | false > 
            : sets whether or not you see damage text for other people
/damagetext range < range >
             : sets the range at which you see other people's damage text
/damagetext list : Prints all of your damage text information.
usage: /trade <msg>\n
Sends a message to the global trade channel.\n
usage:  /tell <target name> <message>\n
usage: /OOC <msg>\n

usage: /alias < ;<new alias string> <replacement string > | add ;<new alias string> <replacement string> | remove  ;<unwanted alias string> | list | clear | clearlist | shortcut ;<alias string> <shortcut location>>\n
sends text of message to named target player\n
Sends a message to the OOC channel in your current area.\n

/alias ;<new alias string> <replacement string>
            : Adds a new alias to the table
/alias add ;<new alias string> <replacement string>
            : Adds a new alias to the table.
/alias remove ;<unwanted alias string>
            : Removes an unwanted alias from the table.
/alias shortcut ;<alias string> <shortcut location>
            : Adds a shortcut to an existing alias to your shortcut bar.
/alias list : Prints all of your alias information.
/alias clear : Clears your alias table.
/alias clearlist : Same as clear.
Activates the Arda encyclopedia.\n
usage: /reclaim - Used to re-create pre-order/promotional items.\n

This command is used to re-create some pre-order/promotional items that you are eligible for in your inventory.  Not all pre-order/promotional items can be reclaimed.  You must have enough space in your inventory to hold all eligible items.  You can only use this command successfully once per week.\n
Initiates synchronized group music playing.\n
usage:  /reply message\n
usage: /shout <text>\n
sends text of message to the last player who sent you a /tell\n
your message will be sent to many people around you.\n

usage: /readycheck
  1)Must be in a Fellowship or Raid.
  2)Must be the leader of the Fellowship or Raid.
This command will present each group member with a dialog asking them if they are ready to go.
usage: /tribe < disband | recruit | accept | decline | quit | expel | promote | demote | motd | successor | resign >\n
usage: /encounter <msg>\n
usage: /playstart\n

(disband) - Disband your tribe.
(recruit <name>) - Recruit the target into your tribe.
(accept) - Accept your current tribe recruitment request.
(decline) - Decline your current tribe recruitment request.
(quit) - Voluntarily leave your tribe.
(expel <name>) - Expel the tribe member from your tribe.
(promote <name>) - Promote the tribe member to the next higher rank.
(demote <name>) - Demote the tribe member to the next lower rank.
(motd <motd>) - Set the message of the day for your tribe.
(successor <name>) - Make the tribe member the member who will succeed you as leader when you resign.
(resign) - Step down as leader. (This will automatically promote your successor to leader.)
Sends a message to your current private encoutner channel.\n
usage: /regional <msg>\n
Sends a message to the regional channel in your current area.\n
usage: /autotarget < on | off >\n
Selects your attacker when attacked, provided you have no current target.  Also selects your nearest enemy if your current target is no longer available.\n
usage: /finditems <item name >\n
Highlights all items matching a particular pattern, or clears the highlighting if no pattern is specified\n
usage: /filterlist\n
Displays a list of valid filter types.\n
usage: /say <text>\n
your message will be sent to nearby players\n
usage: /helpchannel <msg>\n
Sends a message to the help channel in your current area.\n
usage: /joinchannel <channel-name> [password]\n
This will join the specified user chat-channel (creating it, if necessary) with an optional password.\n
usage: /playlist \[<filter>\]\n
Marks yourself as anonymous.  Other players will not be able to see most information about you.\n
usage: /shortcut <shortcut location> <text string> \n
/shortcut <shortcut location> <text string>\n            : Adds a shortcut to a text string into your shortcut bar.\n
Marks yourself as AFK.  You will automatically respond to /tells with the message you supplied.\n
usage: /propose
This command will send a marriage request to your current target.
